Articles.Content:
In my latest save, he was testing a rover design. He decided to try climbing the steepest edge of the launch pad and flipped over. The game decided Jeb was no longer existent. After switching between four vessels, he finally made it out from under the wreckage, but was uncontrollable. He is now MIA somewhere.

On my first save, he is in an elliptical orbit around Kerbin, slowly aerobreaking on each pass of the periapsis.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/76507-My-kerbals-are-in-trouble!

lol.

The UshraKerbal Space agency 23.5 Jeb sighting update.

After spending most of 23 on the mun and piloting most of my station deployments, jebediah took the lead in the ARM missions of 23.5. Parking a couple of class c's in the kerbin system, one at the mun and one at Kerbin. He is currently enroute to link up with the drone piloted ARM craft Hand of Glory at the class E asteroid 'Judgement' in the deorbiter craft Atlas.

Alacrity
At the start of a sundive. When he reaches periapsis, he's going to grab all the low-over-Kerbol science he can before working out when, where and how to execute his return burn.

I just recently updated to 0.23.5 and decided to restart my career game... I'm one of those odd birds that likes the early game where you have a limited selection of parts to achieve your objectives.

Anyways, my Jeb is currently in a "scientific" lander docked to a refueling station in orbit around the Mun, his job is to make drops to the surface to gather up science wherever available. It sounds lonely but not to worry, he has Bob and Manfred in the station's science module to keep him company
Jeb just returned home from Eve after spending waaaay too long in a lander can - alone.

my jeb is stranded somewhere on kerbin after my flying science fortress lost it's right wing in mid-flight during a sharp turn right while in physical time warp.recovery will eventually come ,and get him back a well the 4 crew members.
Jeb sure loves his job
Sitting inside an asteroid eating snacks.

My Jebediah is now taking a rest after the last crew transfer involved a 400m EVA jump inside the atmosphere.

Edited April 15, 2014 by pauix
I forgot the picture :/

In a MK1 pod, 50 meters from the launchpad. he's on a timeout because he was being too wreckless. he's been there since the beggining of the save. I might let him out soon but knowing Jeb i'll probably end up regretting it.

Jeb, Bob and the two mission specialists Phil and Danrod Kerman just finished their Ike insertion.

Time for a new signature! Oh... is that the time? damnnnnnnnnnnnit....
In the Kraken's belly as of right now.
Bouncing across the surface of Gilly... And likely will be for some time.
At KSC after trips to Minmus, the Mun, Duna, Gilly, and Dres. He is awaiting his next mission (probably an Ike trip or going back to get science from Dres, unless I decide that I want to go to Jool).
Currently orbiting Kerbin in my very first successful spaceplane design, ORC - I.
Jeb is now taking a much needed rest after spending 4 weeks on the MÃƒÂ¼n overseeing the establishment of a mining base.

Floating around the sun with Bill and Bob. I intended them to go explore the Jool system, but there's a solar panel blocking the hatch, so Bill and Bob can't get into the science lab. I'll bring them home when I have other missions off my plate.

Well in fact I've merged multiple saves, so I have plenty of Jebediahs : one in my old station (kind of MIR) one on Duna and one died, waiting for respawn.

Edited April 17, 2014 by Nemecle
Orbiting Duna, waiting for his return window.
he is safely doing his work in the science station 75km above kerbin.The station has a kobuz in case jeb would need to return
Mine just returned from Eve.

Safely on the ground - I'm trying to make minimal use of Kerbals in my current career save (at least until I'm ready to colonise Laythe).

Edited April 17, 2014 by SufficientAnonymity
Got my posts all muddled up
Jeb may or may not be lounging in Kalkutta, following the most unlikely of mission parameter deviations. Then again, it's Jeb, the master of mission parameter deviations.
Relaxing after successful first Mun landing with more bugs than Apollo 11. Someone engineer is getting fired over this.
